org.gearvrf.asynchronous

Class GVRAsynchronousResourceLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.asynchronous.GVRAsynchronousResourceLoader

  • public class GVRAsynchronousResourceLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    Internal API for asynchronous resource loading. You will normally call into this class through GVRContext.loadCompressedTexture(GVRAndroidResource.CompressedTextureCallback, GVRAndroidResource) or GVRContext.loadBitmapTexture(GVRAndroidResource.BitmapTextureCallback, GVRAndroidResource) or GVRContext.loadMesh(GVRAndroidResource.MeshCallback, GVRAndroidResource) .
    Since:
    1.6.1

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public static void setup(GVRContext gvrContext)
        Get device parameters and so on. This is an internal method, public only so it can be called across package boundaries. Calling it from user code is both harmless and pointless.

      • loadCompressedTexture

        public static void loadCompressedTexture(GVRContext gvrContext,
                                         GVRAndroidResource.CompressedTextureCallback callback,
                                         GVRAndroidResource resource)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Load a compressed texture asynchronously. This is the implementation of GVRContext.loadCompressedTexture(GVRAndroidResource.CompressedTextureCallback, GVRAndroidResource) : it will usually be more convenient to call that directly.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - The GVRF context
        callback - Asynchronous notifications
        resource - Stream containing a compressed texture
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If gvrContext or callback parameters are null

      • loadCompressedTexture

        public static void loadCompressedTexture(GVRContext gvrContext,
                                         GVRAndroidResource.CompressedTextureCallback callback,
                                         GVRAndroidResource resource,
                                         int quality)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Load a compressed texture asynchronously. This is the implementation of GVRContext.loadCompressedTexture(GVRAndroidResource.CompressedTextureCallback, GVRAndroidResource) : it will usually be more convenient to call that directly.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - The GVRF context
        callback - Asynchronous notifications
        resource - Basically, a stream containing a compressed texture. Taking a GVRAndroidResource parameter eliminates six overloads.
        quality - Speed/quality tradeoff: should be one of GVRCompressedTexture.SPEED, GVRCompressedTexture.BALANCED, or GVRCompressedTexture.QUALITY, but other values are 'clamped' to one of the recognized values.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If gvrContext or callback parameters are null

      • loadBitmapTexture

        public static void loadBitmapTexture(GVRContext gvrContext,
                                     GVRAndroidResource.BitmapTextureCallback callback,
                                     GVRAndroidResource resource,
                                     int priority)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Load a bitmap texture asynchronously. This is the implementation of GVRContext.loadBitmapTexture(GVRAndroidResource.BitmapTextureCallback, GVRAndroidResource, int) - it will usually be more convenient to call that directly.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - The GVRF context
        callback - Asynchronous notifications
        resource - Basically, a stream containing a compressed texture. Taking a GVRAndroidResource parameter eliminates six overloads.
        priority - A value >= GVRContext.LOWEST_PRIORITY and <= GVRContext.HIGHEST_PRIORITY
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If priority < GVRContext.LOWEST_PRIORITY or > GVRContext.HIGHEST_PRIORITY, or any of the other parameters are null.

      • loadTexture

        public static void loadTexture(GVRContext gvrContext,
                               GVRAndroidResource.CancelableCallback<GVRTexture> callback,
                               GVRAndroidResource resource,
                               int priority,
                               int quality)
        Load a (compressed or bitmapped) texture asynchronously. This is the implementation of GVRContext.loadTexture(org.gearvrf.GVRAndroidResource.TextureCallback, GVRAndroidResource, int, int) - it will usually be more convenient to call that directly.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - The GVRF context
        callback - Asynchronous notifications
        resource - Basically, a stream containing a compressed texture. Taking a GVRAndroidResource parameter eliminates six overloads.
        priority - A value >= GVRContext.LOWEST_PRIORITY and <= GVRContext.HIGHEST_PRIORITY
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If priority < GVRContext.LOWEST_PRIORITY or > GVRContext.HIGHEST_PRIORITY, or any of the other parameters are null.

      • loadFutureTexture

        public static java.util.concurrent.Future<GVRTexture> loadFutureTexture(GVRContext gvrContext,
                                                                        GVRAndroidResource resource,
                                                                        int priority,
                                                                        int quality)
        Load a (compressed or bitmapped) texture asynchronously. This is the implementation of GVRContext.loadFutureTexture(GVRAndroidResource, int, int) - it will usually be more convenient to call that directly.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - The GVRF context
        resource - Basically, a stream containing a texture file. The GVRAndroidResource class has six constructors to handle a wide variety of Android resource types. Taking a GVRAndroidResource here eliminates six overloads.
        priority - This request's priority. Please see the notes on asynchronous priorities in the package description. Also, please note priorities only apply to uncompressed textures (standard Android bitmap files, which can take hundreds of milliseconds to load): compressed textures load so quickly that they are not run through the request scheduler.
        quality - The compressed texture quality parameter: should be one of GVRCompressedTexture.SPEED, GVRCompressedTexture.BALANCED, or GVRCompressedTexture.QUALITY, but other values are 'clamped' to one of the recognized values. Please note that this (currently) only applies to compressed textures; normal bitmapped textures don't take a quality parameter.
        Returns:
        A Future that you can pass to methods like GVRShaders.setMainTexture(Future)

      • loadFutureCubemapTexture

        public static java.util.concurrent.Future<GVRTexture> loadFutureCubemapTexture(GVRContext gvrContext,
                                                                               GVRAndroidResource resource,
                                                                               int priority,
                                                                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> faceIndexMap)
        Load a cube map texture asynchronously. This is the implementation of GVRContext.loadFutureCubemapTexture(GVRAndroidResource) - it will usually be more convenient to call that directly.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - The GVRF context
        resource - A steam containing a zip file which contains six bitmaps. The six bitmaps correspond to +x, -x, +y, -y, +z, and -z faces of the cube map texture respectively. The default names of the six images are "posx.png", "negx.png", "posy.png", "negx.png", "posz.png", and "negz.png", which can be changed by calling GVRCubemapTexture.setFaceNames(String[]).
        priority - This request's priority. Please see the notes on asynchronous priorities in the package description.
        Returns:
        A Future that you can pass to methods like GVRShaders.setMainTexture(Future)

      • loadMesh

        public static void loadMesh(GVRContext gvrContext,
                            GVRAndroidResource.CancelableCallback<GVRMesh> callback,
                            GVRAndroidResource resource,
                            int priority)
        Load a GL mesh asynchronously. This is the implementation of GVRContext.loadMesh(GVRAndroidResource.MeshCallback, GVRAndroidResource, int) - it will usually be more convenient to call that directly.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - The GVRF context
        callback - Asynchronous notifications
        resource - Basically, a stream containing a 3D model. Taking a GVRAndroidResource parameter eliminates six overloads.
        priority - A value >= GVRContext.LOWEST_PRIORITY and <= GVRContext.HIGHEST_PRIORITY
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If priority < GVRContext.LOWEST_PRIORITY or > GVRContext.HIGHEST_PRIORITY, or any of the other parameters are null.
        Since:
        1.6.2

      • loadFutureMesh

        public static java.util.concurrent.Future<GVRMesh> loadFutureMesh(GVRContext gvrContext,
                                                                  GVRAndroidResource resource,
                                                                  int priority)
        Load a GL mesh asynchronously. This is the implementation of GVRContext.loadFutureMesh(GVRAndroidResource, int) - it will usually be more convenient to call that directly.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - The GVRF context
        resource - Basically, a stream containing a 3D model. The GVRAndroidResource class has six constructors to handle a wide variety of Android resource types. Taking a GVRAndroidResource here eliminates six overloads.
        priority - This request's priority. Please see the notes on asynchronous priorities in the package description.
        Returns:
        A Future that you can pass to GVRRenderData.setMesh(Future)

      • decodeStream

        public static Bitmap decodeStream(java.io.InputStream stream,
                                  boolean closeStream)
        An internal method, public only so that GVRContext can make cross-package calls. A synchronous (blocking) wrapper around BitmapFactory.decodeStream that uses an android.graphics.BitmapFactory.Options inTempStorage decode buffer. On low memory, returns half (quarter, eighth, ...) size images.

        If stream is a FileInputStream and is at offset 0 (zero), uses BitmapFactory.decodeFileDescriptor() instead of BitmapFactory.decodeStream().

        Parameters:
        stream - Bitmap stream
        closeStream - If true, closes stream
        Returns:
        Bitmap, or null if cannot be decoded into a bitmap
